priorVersion.title: CDISC Protocol Study Subject Discontinuation Attribute Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C185851

self.title: CDISC Protocol Study Subject Discontinuation Attribute Terminology

definition: A terminology value set relevant to the attributes of the subject discontinuation.
name: Study Subject Discontinuation Attribute Terminology
preferredTerm: CDISC Protocol Study Subject Discontinuation Attribute Terminology

terms.definition: A description of the provisions or stipulations under which the subject may withdraw themselves from the study, following local and national regulations.
A description of the process by which information about the health status of a subject is obtained after that subject has withdrawn from the study.
The set of protocol-defined criteria that qualifies a study subject as being lost to follow-up.
The loss or lack of continuation of a subject to follow-up.
The explanation for why the enrolled subject concluded participation, prior to completion of all protocol-required elements, in a study.
The explanation or rationale as to why the subject withdrew from the study.
terms.preferredTerm: Reason for Subject Withdrawal from Study
terms.submissionValue: Reason for Subject Withdrawal from Study

terms.definition: The set of protocol-defined criteria that serves to determine whether and how an enrolled subject may conclude participation in a study, prior to completion of all protocol-required elements.
A description of the stepwise set of actions taken when a subject discontinues participation in a study.
An indication that the consent to participate in the study, or one or more components of the study, has been revoked.
The subject-initiated act of discontinuing participation in the study as a whole or one or more aspects of the study (e.g., a study period or use of biospecimens).
